New Records: South Africa scored 113/6 in 20 overs, with Heinrich Klaasen contributing 46 runs.
Keshav Maharaj took 3 wickets, including two in the final over.
Anrich Nortje and Kagiso Rabada each took 2 wickets.
Bangladesh scored 109/7 in 20 overs, with Towhid Hridoy scoring 37 runs.
Key Match Events: South Africa won by 4 runs in the final over.
Mahmudullah was dismissed on a full toss by Keshav Maharaj in the last over.
11 runs were needed off the last over, with South Africa successfully defending their target.
Towhid Hridoy was dismissed in a crucial lbw decision by Kagiso Rabada.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa won the toss and chose to bat first.
The match was expected to be close, aligning with the final outcome.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's win was a pivotal moment in their T20 World Cup campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in New York, and the weather conditions were favorable.
